element.name: Survival Domain
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: Clerics and shamans of primitive tribes living in harsh environments have no greater mission than ensuring the survival of their tribes. The gods of survival often have other domains in similar realms, such as life or nature. The worshippers who work within the Survival domain, however, are much more primal and brutal than their counterparts.

The gods of primitive and uncivilized races are most likely to hold this domain: lizardfolk god Semuanya and orc goddess Luthic are prime examples of deities whose clerics embrace the Survival domain. They are more likely to remain in their territories, nurturing and protecting their flocks, but fighting fiercely when a threat invades their lairs.

sheet.description: Clerics and shamans of primitive tribes living in harsh environments have no greater mission than ensuring the survival of their tribes.

element.name: Domain Spells
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric level listed in the Survival Domain Spells Table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

td.em: create or destroy water, false life
locate animals or plants, prayer of healing

element.name: Bonus Proficiency
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the Survival and Nature skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability checks you make that use those skills.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in the Survival and Nature skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability checks you make that use those skills.

element.name: Stand the Fallen
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: Also starting at 1st level, when you cast the spare the dying cantrip, you can make the following changes to the spell: change the range from touch to 30 feet, and the creature gains 1 hit point instead of becoming stable.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long or short rest.

sheet.description: When you cast the spare the dying cantrip, you can make the following changes to the spell: change the range from touch to 30 feet, and the creature gains 1 hit point instead of becoming stable.

element.name: Channel Divinity: Encourage the Troops
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to bolster the fighting abilities of your allies.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and invoke the survival instincts of your deity. Each allied creature that can see you gains advantage on their next melee or ranged weapon attack before the start of your next turn. If their attack hits, the allied creature also regains hit points equal to your cleric level.

sheet.description: As an action, you present your holy symbol and invoke the survival instincts of your deity. Each allied creature that can see you gains advantage on their next melee or ranged weapon attack before the start of your next turn. If their attack hits, the allied creature also regains {{level:cleric}} hit points.

element.name: Channel Divinity: Push the Limits
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: At 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to strengthen the resolve your allies. All allied creatures within 30 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to your cleric level.

sheet.description: All allied creatures within 30 feet of you gain {{level:cleric}} temporary hit points.

element.name: Potent Spellcasting
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: At 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You add your Wisdom modifier ({{wisdom:modifier}}) to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

element.name: Protection of the Tribe
element.source: Xanathar’s Lost Notes to Everything Else

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you can use a bonus action to make one allied creature who you can see immune to damage for a short time. The chosen creature is immune to all damage until the start of your next turn. You regain the use of this ability when you finish a long rest.
